name: Lemon Bars
ingredients: 1 cup butter, softened dash of salt
1 stick of butter, softened 1 tsp. vanilla
8 oz. cream cheese, softened 2 cups sifted powdered sugar
1 stick butter, melted 1/3 cup diced walnuts
1 small package graham crackers, crushed ½ cup coconut (optional)
2 cups chocolate chips 1 14oz. can sweetened condensed milk
1 cup corn syrup 1 cup chocolate chips
1 cup creamy peanut butter 1 cup butterscotch chips
steps: Combine and mix well. Press in a 9x13 pan. Bake 15 minutes at 350 or until barely brown.
Pour on cooked crust. Then bake at 350 for 20-­‐25 minutes. Make sure you don't overcook them. You don't
want it to jiggle and you don't want to overcook either.
Watch carefully. Slightly cool and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Pipe frosting in zigzag pattern or cover entirely
Heat oven to 350°. Combine butter and graham crackers with a fork in the bottom of a 9x13 baking dish. Layer in
this order: chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, walnuts, then coconut. Pour condensed milk evenly over top.
Bake for 25 minutes or until just golden and bubbly.
Bring almost to a boil: sugar and corn syrup. Remove from heat and immediately stir in peanut butter and
rice crispies, mash into a 9 x 13 pan (sprayed with Pam) Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips.
Pour on top and spread. Refidgerate 20 minutes, then cut.
